page.title: 01North Downs at Buckland
page.content: The block is sharply bounded on the north by the North Downs escarpment, rising to 600ft, scarred on the south face by worked out lime excavations. To the south the area is bounded by part of Betchworth village including the school; to the west by agricultural land, both arable & rough grazing, and some nursery gardens; & to the east by mixed farm land & sandpits. The area is crossed by one north-south road, Pebble Hill (B2032); & from east to west by (i) the North Downs Long Distance footpath; (ii) the Southern Railway Tonbridge to Reading line (hourly trains from Betchworth Station in both directions on weekdays) and (iii) the A25 (Wrotham, Kent, to Guildford) road. The new M25 briefly cuts the NE corner of the block.
